icmTeam: Microsoft Azure Sentinel/Data Collection and Processing

tables.name: AWSVPCFlow
tables.description: VPC Flow Logs, which ingested from Sentinel's connector, enables you to capture IP traffic going to and from your AWS VPC network interfaces.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the event was generated. This value will be the same as 'start' input field or the data arrival time to Azure Monitor in case the 'start' input field is empty or missing.

columns.name: Version
columns.description: The VPC Flow Logs version.

columns.name: AccountId
columns.description: The AWS account ID of the owner of the source network interface for which traffic is recorded. If the network interface is created by an AWS service, for example when creating a VPC endpoint or Network Load Balancer, the record may display unknown for this field.

columns.name: InterfaceId
columns.description: The ID of the network interface for which the traffic is recorded.

columns.name: SrcAddr
columns.description: The source address for incoming traffic.

columns.name: DstAddr
columns.description: The destination address for outgoing traffic.

columns.name: SrcPort
columns.description: The source port of the traffic.

columns.name: DstPort
columns.description: The destination port of the traffic.

columns.name: Protocol
columns.description: The IANA protocol number of the traffic.

columns.name: Packets
columns.description: The number of packets transferred during the flow.

columns.name: Bytes
columns.description: The number of bytes transferred during the flow.

columns.name: End
columns.description: The time when the last packet of the flow was received within the aggregation interval.

columns.name: Action
columns.description: The action that is associated with the traffic.

columns.name: LogStatus
columns.description: The logging status of the flow log.

columns.name: VpcId
columns.description: The ID of the VPC.

columns.name: SubnetId
columns.description: The ID of the subnet.

columns.name: InstanceId
columns.description: The ID of the instance that's associated with network interface for which the traffic is recorded.

columns.name: TcpFlags
columns.description: The bitmask value for the following TCP flags.

columns.name: TrafficType
columns.description: The type of traffic. The possible values are: IPv4, IPv6, and EFA. For more information search for 'Elastic Fabric Adapter (EFA)'.

columns.name: PktSrcAddr
columns.description: The packet-level (original) source IP address of the traffic.

columns.name: PktDstAddr
columns.description: The packet-level (original) destination IP address for the traffic.

columns.name: Region
columns.description: The Region that contains the network interface for which traffic is recorded.

columns.name: AzId
columns.description: The ID of the Availability Zone.

columns.name: SublocationType
columns.description: The type of sublocation that is returned in the sublocationId field.

columns.name: SublocationId
columns.description: The ID of the sublocation that contains the network interface for which traffic is recorded.

columns.name: PktSrcAwsService
columns.description: The name of the subset of IP address ranges for the PktSrcAddr field, if the source IP address is for an AWS service.

columns.name: PktDstAwsService
columns.description: The name of the subset of IP address ranges for the PktDstAddr field, if the destination IP address is for an AWS service.

columns.name: FlowDirection
columns.description: The direction of the flow with respect to the interface where traffic is captured.

columns.name: TrafficPath
columns.description: The path that egress traffic takes to the destination.

tables.name: AWSGuardDuty
tables.description: Guard Duty Findings, which ingested from Sentinel's connector, represents a potential security issue detected within your network. GuardDuty generates a finding whenever it detects unexpected and potentially malicious activity in your AWS environment.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the event was generated, The last time this finding was updated with new activity matching the pattern that prompted GuardDuty to generate this finding.

columns.name: SchemaVersion
columns.description: The Guard Duty finding version.

columns.name: AccountId
columns.description: The AWS account ID of the owner of the source network interface for which traffic is recorded. If the network interface is created by an AWS service, for example when creating a VPC endpoint or Network Load Balancer, the record may display unknown for this field.

columns.name: Region
columns.description: The AWS region in which the finding was generated.

columns.name: Partition
columns.description: The AWS partition in which the finding was generated.

columns.name: Id
columns.description: A unique Finding ID for this finding type and set of parameters. New occurrences of activity matching this pattern will be aggregated to the same ID.

columns.name: Arn
columns.description: Amazon resource name of the finding.

columns.name: ActivityType
columns.description: A formatted string representing the type of activity that triggered the finding.

columns.name: ResourceDetails
columns.description: Gives details on the AWS resource that was targeted by the trigger activity. The information available varies based on resource type and action typ.

columns.name: ServiceDetails
columns.description: Gives details on the AWS service that was related to the finding, including Action, Actor/Target, Evidence, Anomalous behavior and Additional information.

columns.name: Severity
columns.description: A finding's assigned severity level of either High, Medium, or Low.

columns.name: TimeCreated
columns.description: The time and date when this finding was first created. If this value differs from Updated at (TimeGenerated), it indicates that the activity has occurred multiple times and is an ongoing issue.

columns.name: Title
columns.description: Summary of the primary purpose of the threat or attack related to the finding.

columns.name: Description
columns.description: Description of the primary purpose of the threat or attack related to the finding.

tables.name: AWSCloudTrail
tables.description: CloudTrail logs, which ingested from Sentinel's connector, holds all your data and management events of your Amazon Wev Services account.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC). An event's time stamp comes from the local host that provides the service API endpoint on which the API call was made.

columns.name: AwsEventId
columns.description: GUID generated by CloudTrail to uniquely identify each event. You can use this value to identify a single event.

columns.name: EventVersion
columns.description: The version of the log event format.

columns.name: EventSource
columns.description: The service that the request was made to. This name is typically a short form of the service name without spaces plus .amazonaws.com.

columns.name: EventTypeName
columns.description: Identifies the type of event that generated the event record. This can be the one of the following values: AwsApiCall, AwsServiceEvent, AwsConsoleAction , AwsConsoleSignIn.

columns.name: EventName
columns.description: The requested action, which is one of the actions in the API for that service.

columns.name: UserIdentityType
columns.description: The type of the identity. The following values are possible: Root, IAMUser, AssumedRole, FederatedUser, Directory, AWSAccount, AWSService, Unknown.

columns.name: UserIdentityPrincipalid
columns.description: A unique identifier for the entity that made the call.

columns.name: UserIdentityArn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the principal that made the call.

columns.name: UserIdentityAccountId
columns.description: The account that owns the entity that granted permissions for the request.

columns.name: UserIdentityInvokedBy
columns.description: The name of the AWS service that made the request.

columns.name: UserIdentityAccessKeyId
columns.description: The access key ID that was used to sign the request.

columns.name: UserIdentityUserName
columns.description: The name of the identity that made the call.

columns.name: SessionMfaAuthenticated
columns.description: The value is true if the root user or IAM user whose credentials were used for the request also was authenticated with an MFA device; otherwise, false.

columns.name: SessionCreationDate
columns.description: The date and time when the temporary security credentials were issued.

columns.name: SessionIssuerType
columns.description: The source of the temporary security credentials, such as Root, IAMUser, or Role.

columns.name: SessionIssuerPrincipalId
columns.description: The internal ID of the entity that was used to get credentials.

columns.name: SessionIssuerArn
columns.description: The ARN of the source (account, IAM user, or role) that was used to get temporary security credentials.

columns.name: SessionIssuerAccountId
columns.description: The account that owns the entity that was used to get credentials.

columns.name: SessionIssuerUserName
columns.description: The friendly name of the user or role that issued the session.

columns.name: EC2RoleDelivery
columns.description: The friendly name of the user or role that issued the session.

columns.name: AWSRegion
columns.description: The AWS region that the request was made to.

columns.name: SourceIpAddress
columns.description: The IP address that the request was made from. For actions that originate from the service console, the address reported is for the underlying customer resource, not the console web server. For services in AWS, only the DNS name is displayed.

columns.name: UserAgent
columns.description: The agent through which the request was made, such as the AWS Management Console, an AWS service, the AWS SDKs or the AWS CLI.
The AWS service error if the request returns an error.

columns.name: ErrorMessage
columns.description: The error description when available. This message includes messages for authorization failures. CloudTrail captures the message logged by the service in its exception handling.

columns.name: RequestParameters
columns.description: The parameters, if any, that were sent with the request. These parameters are documented in the API reference documentation for the appropriate AWS service.

columns.name: ResponseElements
columns.description: The response element for actions that make changes (create, update, or delete actions). If an action does not change state (for example, a request to get or list objects), this element is omitted.

columns.name: AdditionalEventData
columns.description: Additional data about the event that was not part of the request or response.

columns.name: AwsRequestId
columns.description: deprecated, please use AwsRequestId_ instead.

columns.name: AwsRequestId_
columns.description: The value that identifies the request. The service being called generates this value.

columns.name: Resources
columns.description: A list of resources accessed in the event.

columns.name: APIVersion
columns.description: Identifies the API version associated with the AwsApiCall eventType value.

columns.name: ReadOnly
columns.description: Identifies whether this operation is a read-only operation.
Represents the account ID that received this event. The recipientAccountID may be different from the CloudTrail userIdentity Element accountId. This can occur in cross-account resource access.

columns.name: ServiceEventDetails
columns.description: Identifies the service event, including what triggered the event and the result.

columns.name: SharedEventId
columns.description: GUID generated by CloudTrail to uniquely identify CloudTrail events from the same AWS action that is sent to different AWS accounts.

columns.name: VpcEndpointId
columns.description: Identifies the VPC endpoint in which requests were made from a VPC to another AWS service.

columns.name: ManagementEvent
columns.description: A Boolean value that identifies whether the event is a management event.

columns.name: SourceSystem
columns.description: Constant value: AWSCloudTrail.
Constant value: CloudTrail.
Shows the event category that is used in LookupEvents calls.

columns.name: TlsVersion
columns.description: Optional. Part of tlsDetails. The TLS version of a request.

columns.name: CipherSuite
columns.description: Optional. Part of tlsDetails. The cipher suite (combination of security algorithms used) of a request.

columns.name: ClientProvidedHostHeader
columns.description: Optional. Part of tlsDetails. The client-provided host name used in the service API call, which is typically the FQDN of the service endpoint.

columns.name: IpProtocol
columns.description: The IP protocol is located under RequestParameters in CloudTrail, and it is used to specify the IP permissions for a security group rule. The IP protocol name or number. The valid values are tcp, udp, icmp, or a protocol number.

columns.name: SourcePort
columns.description: The SourcePort is located under RequestParameters in CloudTrail, and it is used to specify the IP permissions for a security group rule. The start of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP type number.

columns.name: DestinationPort
columns.description: The DestinationPort is located under RequestParameters in CloudTrail, and it is used to specify the IP permissions for a security group rule. The end of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP code.

columns.name: CidrIp
columns.description: The CIDR IP is located under RequestParameters in CloudTrail, and it is used to specify the IP permissions for a security group rule. The IPv4 CIDR range.

tables.name: AWSCloudWatch
tables.description: The CloudWatch Logs provide performance and billing data from the AWS CloudWatch service which helps the user better understand and operate the AWS system and application.

columns.name: ExtractedTime
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the event was generated.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) when the event was generated and equals to 'ExtractedTime' when included in message. If timestamp is missing, itâ€™s set to the ingestion time.

columns.name: Message
columns.description: The data contained within logs from CloudWatch.

tables.name: AWSWAF
tables.description: AWS WAF logs, collected in AWS S3 buckets, to Microsoft Sentinel. AWS WAF logs are detailed records of traffic that web access control lists (ACLs) analyze, which are essential for maintaining the security and performance of web applications.

columns.name: Action
columns.description: The terminating action taken by AWS WAF (ALLOW, BLOCK, CAPTCHA, or Challenge).

columns.name: Args
columns.description: The query string parameters of the request.

columns.name: CaptchaResponse
columns.description: Status of the CAPTCHA action for the request.

columns.name: ChallengeResponse
columns.description: Status of the security challenge for the request.

columns.name: ClientIp
columns.description: IP address of the client making the request.

columns.name: Country
columns.description: Country of origin for the request.

columns.name: ExcludedRules
columns.description: Rules excluded from evaluation in the rule group.

columns.name: FormatVersion
columns.description: Version of the AWS WAF log format.

columns.name: Headers
columns.description: Headers included in the HTTP request.

columns.name: HttpMethod
columns.description: The HTTP method (GET, POST, etc.) of the request.

columns.name: HttpRequest
columns.description: Metadata about the HTTP request.

columns.name: HttpSourceId
columns.description: ID of the associated resource (e.g., CloudFront distribution, Load Balancer).

columns.name: HttpSourceName
columns.description: Source of the request (e.g., CF, APIGW, ALB).

columns.name: HttpVersion
columns.description: HTTP version used in the request.

columns.name: Ja3Fingerprint
columns.description: JA3 fingerprint of the TLS Client Hello.

columns.name: Labels
columns.description: Labels applied to the request by rules.

columns.name: NonTerminatingMatchingRules
columns.description: List of rules that matched but didn't terminate the request.

columns.name: OversizeFields
columns.description: Fields in the request that exceeded AWS WAF inspection limits.

columns.name: RateBasedRuleList
columns.description: List of rate-based rules applied to the request.

columns.name: RequestHeadersInserted
columns.description: Headers inserted for custom request handling.

columns.name: RequestId
columns.description: Request ID for the network request.

columns.name: ResponseCodeSent
columns.description: HTTP response code sent to the client.

columns.name: RuleGroupId
columns.description: ID of the rule group that matched.

columns.name: RuleGroupList
columns.description: List of rule groups that acted on the request.

columns.name: TerminatingRule
columns.description: The rule that terminated the request. If this is present, it contains action, ruleId, ruleMatchDetails, and any additional information provided for each rule varies according factors such as the rule configuration, rule match type, and details of the match.

columns.name: TerminatingRuleId
columns.description: ID of the network rule that matched.

columns.name: TerminatingRuleMatchDetails
columns.description: Details of the rule that terminated the request.

columns.name: TerminatingRuleType
columns.description: Type of rule that terminated the request.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Timestamp when the log was processed.

columns.name: Uri
columns.description: The URI of the request.

columns.name: WebAclId
columns.description: The GUID of the web ACL applied to the request.

tables.name: AWSSecurityHubFindings
tables.description: AWS Security Hub Findings, which are collected in AWS S3 buckets, into Microsoft Sentinel. AWS Security Hub Finding is a detailed record of a security check or security-related detection, which can originate from various sources like enabled controls, integrations with other AWS services, third-party products, or custom integrations.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp when the event was generated.

columns.name: AwsRegion
columns.description: The AWS region where the event occurred.

columns.name: AwsAccountId
columns.description: The AWS account ID associated with the event.

columns.name: ComplianceStatus
columns.description: The compliance status of the resource (e.g., COMPLIANT, NON_COMPLIANT).

columns.name: ComplianceStatusReasons
columns.description: The reasons for the compliance status.

columns.name: ComplianceSecurityControlId
columns.description: The ID of the security control related to compliance.

columns.name: ComplianceSecurityControlParameters
columns.description: Parameters associated with the security control.

columns.name: ComplianceRelatedRequirements
columns.description: The related compliance requirements.

columns.name: ComplianceAssociatedStandards
columns.description: The compliance standards associated with the resource.

columns.name: AwsSecurityFindingTitle
columns.description: The title of the AWS security finding.

columns.name: AwsSecurityFindingId
columns.description: The unique identifier for the AWS security finding.

columns.name: AwsSecurityFindingDescription
columns.description: A detailed description of the AWS security finding.

columns.name: AwsSecurityFindingTypes
columns.description: The types or categories of the AWS security finding.

columns.name: AwsSecurityFindingCreatedAt
columns.description: The timestamp when the security finding was created.

columns.name: AwsSecurityFindingFirstObservedAt
columns.description: The timestamp when the security finding was first observed.

columns.name: AwsSecurityFindingUpdatedAt
columns.description: The timestamp when the security finding was last updated.

columns.name: AwsSecurityFindingLastObservedAt
columns.description: The timestamp when the security finding was last observed.

columns.name: AwsSecurityFindingProcessedAt
columns.description: The timestamp when the security finding was processed.

columns.name: AwsSecurityFindingGeneratorId
columns.description: The ID of the generator that created the security finding.

columns.name: AwsSecurityFindingProductArn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the product that generated the finding.

columns.name: AwsSecurityFindingProductName
columns.description: The name of the product that generated the finding.

columns.name: AwsSecurityFindingProductFields
columns.description: Additional fields provided by the product that generated the finding.

columns.name: AwsSecurityFindingSeverity
columns.description: The severity level of the security finding.

columns.name: Remediation
columns.description: Details about how to remediate the security finding.

columns.name: SchemaVersion
columns.description: The version of the schema used for the finding.

columns.name: Resources
columns.description: The resources associated with the security finding.

columns.name: RecordState
columns.description: The state of the record (e.g., ACTIVE, ARCHIVED).

columns.name: WorkflowState
columns.description: The workflow state of the finding (e.g., NEW, RESOLVED).

columns.name: RawData
columns.description: The raw data associated with the finding.

tables.name: AWSNetworkFirewallAlert
tables.description: The AWS Platform Firewall Alert logs , ingested from Sentinel's connector, enabling real-time analysis and correlation with other security data sources.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp when the log entry was created in AWS Network Firewall.

columns.name: FirewallName
columns.description: The name of the AWS Network Firewall instance generating the log.

columns.name: AvailabilityZone
columns.description: The AWS Availability Zone where the firewall instance is located.

columns.name: TxId
columns.description: The transaction ID associated with the specific network flow.

columns.name: EventTimestamp
columns.description: The epoch timestamp of when the event occurred.

columns.name: AppProto
columns.description: The application layer protocol detected.

columns.name: SrcIp
columns.description: The source port from which the packet originated.

columns.name: SrcPort
columns.description: The source port from which the packet originated.

columns.name: EventType
columns.description: The type of event recorded (e.g., alert, flow, drop, pass).

columns.name: Severity
columns.description: The severity level of the event, typically based on Suricata rule classifications.

columns.name: SignatureId
columns.description: The unique identifier of the Suricata rule that matched the event.

columns.name: Rev
columns.description: The revision number of the matched Suricata rule.

columns.name: Signature
columns.description: The name or description of the Suricata rule that triggered the alert.

columns.name: AlertAction
columns.description: The action taken when an alert was triggered (e.g., allowed, dropped, rejected).

columns.name: Category
columns.description: The category of the detected threat or network activity.

columns.name: FlowId
columns.description: A unique identifier for the network flow related to this event.

columns.name: DestIp
columns.description: The destination IP address of the packet.

columns.name: Proto
columns.description: The protocol used (e.g., TCP, UDP, ICMP).

columns.name: VerdictAction
columns.description: The final decision made by the firewall (e.g., pass, drop, alert).

columns.name: Sni
columns.description: The Server Name Indication (SNI) from TLS traffic.

columns.name: Version
columns.description: The version of the log schema or Suricata rule format used.

columns.name: DestPort
columns.description: The destination port to which the packet was sent.

columns.name: PktSrc
columns.description: The source of the packet (e.g., internal, external, firewall rule).

columns.name: Direction
columns.description: The direction of the traffic (e.g., inbound, outbound).

columns.name: Timestamp
columns.description: The exact timestamp when the event was captured.

tables.name: AWSNetworkFirewallFlow
tables.description: The AWS Platform Firewall Flow logs, ingested from Sentinel's connector, enabling real-time analysis and correlation with other security data sources like Detection alerts, firewall events network traffic logs, and more.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp when the log entry was created in AWS Network Firewall.

columns.name: FirewallName
columns.description: The name of the AWS Network Firewall instance generating the log.

columns.name: AvailabilityZone
columns.description: The AWS Availability Zone where the firewall instance is located.

columns.name: EventTimestamp
columns.description: The epoch timestamp of when the event occurred.

columns.name: TCPFlags
columns.description: The TCP flags observed in the packet

columns.name: Syn
columns.description: Indicates whether the SYN flag is set in the TCP packet (true/false).

columns.name: Fin
columns.description: Indicates whether the FIN flag is set in the TCP packet (true/false).

columns.name: Psh
columns.description: Indicates whether the PSH flag is set in the TCP packet (true/false).

columns.name: Ack
columns.description: Indicates whether the ACK flag is set in the TCP packet (true/false).

columns.name: Ecn
columns.description: Indicates whether the ECN flag is set in the TCP packet (true/false).

columns.name: Rst
columns.description: Indicates whether the RST flag is set in the TCP packet (true/false).

columns.name: AppProto
columns.description: The application layer protocol detected (e.g., HTTP, HTTPS, DNS).

columns.name: SrcIp
columns.description: The source IP address of the packet that triggered the event.

columns.name: SrcPort
columns.description: The source port from which the packet originated.

columns.name: NetFlowPkts
columns.description: The number of packets in the network flow.

columns.name: NetFlowBytes
columns.description: The total number of bytes transferred in the network flow.

columns.name: NetFlowStart
columns.description: The timestamp when the network flow started.

columns.name: NetFlowEnd
columns.description: The timestamp when the network flow ended.

columns.name: NetFlowAge
columns.description: The duration of the network flow in seconds.

columns.name: NetFlowMinttl
columns.description: The minimum Time-to-Live (TTL) observed in the network flow.

columns.name: NetFlowMaxttl
columns.description: The maximum Time-to-Live (TTL) observed in the network flow.

columns.name: EventType
columns.description: The type of event recorded (e.g., flow, alert, drop, pass).

columns.name: FlowId
columns.description: A unique identifier for the network flow related to this event.

columns.name: DestIp
columns.description: The destination IP address of the packet.

columns.name: Proto
columns.description: The protocol used (e.g., TCP, UDP, ICMP).

columns.name: DestPort
columns.description: The destination port to which the packet was sent.

columns.name: Timestamp
columns.description: The exact timestamp when the event was captured.

tables.name: AWSNetworkFirewallTls
tables.description: The AWS Platform Firewall TLS logs, ingested from Sentinel's connector, enabling real-time analysis and correlation with other security data sources.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp when the log entry was created in AWS Network Firewall.

columns.name: FirewallName
columns.description: The name of the AWS Network Firewall instance generating the log.

columns.name: AvailabilityZone
columns.description: The AWS Availability Zone where the firewall instance is located.

columns.name: EventTimestamp
columns.description: The epoch timestamp of when the event occurred.

columns.name: SrcIp
columns.description: The source IP address of the packet that triggered the event.

columns.name: SrcPort
columns.description: The source port from which the packet originated.

columns.name: DestIp
columns.description: The destination IP address of the packet.

columns.name: DestPort
columns.description: The destination port to which the packet was sent.

columns.name: Sni
columns.description: The Server Name Indication (SNI) from TLS traffic.

columns.name: LeafCertificateFingerprint
columns.description: The SHA-256 fingerprint of the leaf certificate observed in the TLS handshake.

columns.name: Status
columns.description: The status of the TLS inspection event (e.g., success, failure).

columns.name: Action
columns.description: The action taken by the firewall (e.g., allowed, dropped, inspected).

columns.name: ErrorMessage
columns.description: Any error message associated with the event, if applicable.

tables.name: AWSRoute53Resolver
tables.description: This connector enables ingestion of AWS Route 53 DNS logs into Microsoft Sentinel for enhanced visibility and threat detection. It supports DNS Resolver query logs ingested directly from AWS S3 buckets, while Public DNS query logs and Route 53 audit logs can be ingested using Microsoft Sentinel's AWS CloudWatch and CloudTrail connectors. Comprehensive instructions are provided to guide you through the setup of each log type. Leverage this connector to monitor DNS activity, detect potential threats, and improve your security posture in cloud environments.

columns.name: Version
columns.description: Version of the log format.

columns.name: AccountId
columns.description: The AWS account ID that owns the VPC which sent the query.

columns.name: LogType
columns.description: Indicates the type of DNS log (e.g. ResolverQueryLogs).

columns.name: Region
columns.description: AWS region where the log was generated.

columns.name: VpcId
columns.description: The ID of the VPC where the DNS query originated.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The time the DNS query was received by Route 53 Resolver.

columns.name: QueryName
columns.description: The domain name that was queried.

columns.name: QueryType
columns.description: The DNS record type requested (e.g. A, AAAA, MX).

columns.name: QueryClass
columns.description: The DNS query class. Usually IN (Internet).

columns.name: Rcode
columns.description: Textual DNS response code (e.g. NOERROR, NXDOMAIN).

columns.name: Answers
columns.description: Array of DNS response records, including resolved IP addresses and other query-related information.

columns.name: SrcAddr
columns.description: The source IP address of the instance that made the query.

columns.name: SrcPort
columns.description: The source port on the instance that made the query.

columns.name: Transport
columns.description: The protocol used to send the query (e.g. UDP, TCP, TLS).

columns.name: SrcIds
columns.description: Identifiers related to the source instance where the DNS query originated from or passed through.

columns.name: FirewallRuleAction
columns.description: Rule action from the matching firewall rule.

columns.name: FirewallRuleGroupId
columns.description: ID of the firewall rule group that applied to the query.

columns.name: FirewallDomainListId
columns.description: ID of the domain list that matched the query domain.

tables.name: AWSS3ServerAccess
tables.description: This stack integrates Microsoft Sentinel by creating an IAM role with minimal permissions for accessing S3 server access logs stored in a specified S3 bucket and sending log events to an SQS queue.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The time the AWS Server Access log was received by the S3 bucket, in UTC.

columns.name: BucketOwner
columns.description: The canonical user ID of the owner of the source bucket (another form of AWS account ID).

columns.name: Bucket
columns.description: The name of the S3 bucket against which the request was processed.

columns.name: RemoteIp
columns.description: The apparent IP address of the requester (may be obscured by proxies or firewalls).

columns.name: Requester
columns.description: The canonical user ID, IAM user, or assumed role making the request, or '-' for unauthenticated.

columns.name: RequestId
columns.description: A unique string ID generated by Amazon S3 to identify the request.

columns.name: Operation
columns.description: The operation type (e.g., REST.PUT.OBJECT, S3.LIFECYCLETRANSITION.OBJECT).

columns.name: Key
columns.description: The object key (name) involved in the request.

columns.name: RequestUri
columns.description: The URI part of the HTTP request.

columns.name: HttpStatus
columns.description: The HTTP status code returned in the response.

columns.name: ErrorCode
columns.description: The S3 error code returned in the response, or '-' if none.

columns.name: BytesSent
columns.description: Number of response bytes sent, excluding HTTP overhead, or 0.

columns.name: ObjectSize
columns.description: The size of the object in bytes.

columns.name: TotalTime
columns.description: The total time in milliseconds the request was in flight (from receipt to last response byte sent).

columns.name: TurnAroundTime
columns.description: The time in milliseconds S3 spent processing the request (from last request byte to first response byte).

columns.name: Referer
columns.description: The value of the HTTP Referer header (linking page URL), if present.

columns.name: UserAgent
columns.description: The value of the HTTP User-Agent header (e.g., client software or browser).

columns.name: VersionId
columns.description: The version ID of the object involved in the request, or '-' if not applicable.

columns.name: HostId
columns.description: Amazon S3 extended request ID (x-amz-id-2).

columns.name: SignatureVersion
columns.description: The signature version (SigV2 or SigV4) used to authenticate the request, or '-' for unauthenticated.

columns.name: CipherSuite
columns.description: The TLS cipher suite negotiated for HTTPS, or '-' for HTTP.

columns.name: AuthenticationType
columns.description: The authentication type used: AuthHeader, QueryString, or '-' for unauthenticated requests.

columns.name: HostHeader
columns.description: The endpoint (host header) used to connect to S3 (e.g., s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com).

columns.name: TLSVersion
columns.description: The TLS version used by the client (e.g., TLSv1.2), or '-' if TLS wasn't used.

columns.name: AccessPointARN
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the S3 access point used for the request, or '-' if not used.

columns.name: ACLRequired
columns.description: Indicates if an ACL was required for the request: 'Yes' if required, '-' otherwise.

tables.description: This connector allows you to ingest AWS Elastic Load Balancer (ALB, NLB and GLB) logs into Microsoft Sentinel. These logs contain detailed records for requests handled by your load balancers, including client IPs, latencies, request paths, and status codes. These logs are useful for monitoring traffic patterns, investigating anomalies, and ensuring security compliance.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp when the log was collected or ingested.

columns.name: Version
columns.description: The version of the flow log format.

columns.name: AccountId
columns.description: The AWS account ID that owns the network interface.

columns.name: InterfaceId
columns.description: The ID of the network interface for which the traffic is recorded.

columns.name: SourceAddress
columns.description: The source IP address of the traffic.

columns.name: DestinationAddress
columns.description: The destination IP address of the traffic.

columns.name: SourcePort
columns.description: The source port of the traffic.

columns.name: DestinationPort
columns.description: The destination port of the traffic.

columns.name: Protocol
columns.description: The IANA protocol number of the traffic (e.g., 6 for TCP, 17 for UDP).

columns.name: Packets
columns.description: The number of packets transferred during the flow.

columns.name: Bytes
columns.description: The number of bytes transferred during the flow.

columns.name: SStartTime
columns.description: The start time of the flow in Unix seconds.

columns.name: EndTime
columns.description: The end time of the flow in Unix seconds.

columns.name: Action
columns.description: Indicates whether the traffic was accepted or rejected.

columns.name: LogStatus
columns.description: Indicates the logging status (e.g., OK, NODATA, SKIPDATA).

columns.name: LogType
columns.description: Type of the log (e.g., VPCFlowLog, TransitGatewayFlowLog).

These logs contain detailed records for requests handled by your load balancers, including client IPs, latencies, request paths, and status codes. These logs are useful for monitoring traffic patterns, investigating anomalies, and ensuring security compliance.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp when the log was collected or ingested.

columns.name: Version
columns.description: The version of the flow log format.

columns.name: AccountId
columns.description: The AWS account ID that owns the network interface.

columns.name: InterfaceId
columns.description: The ID of the network interface for which the traffic is recorded.

columns.name: SourceAddress
columns.description: The source IP address of the traffic.

columns.name: DestinationAddress
columns.description: The destination IP address of the traffic.

columns.name: SourcePort
columns.description: The source port of the traffic.

columns.name: DestinationPort
columns.description: The destination port of the traffic.

columns.name: Protocol
columns.description: The IANA protocol number of the traffic (e.g., 6 for TCP, 17 for UDP).

columns.name: Packets
columns.description: The number of packets transferred during the flow.

columns.name: Bytes
columns.description: The number of bytes transferred during the flow.

columns.name: SStartTime
columns.description: The start time of the flow in Unix seconds.

columns.name: EndTime
columns.description: The end time of the flow in Unix seconds.

columns.name: Action

columns.name: LogStatus
columns.description: Indicates the logging status (e.g., OK, NODATA, SKIPDATA).

columns.name: LogType
columns.description: Type of the log (e.g., VPCFlowLog, TransitGatewayFlowLog).

tables.name: AWSNLBAccessLogs
tables.description: This connector allows you to ingest AWS Elastic Load Balancer (ALB, NLB and GLB) logs into Microsoft Sentinel. These logs contain detailed records for requests handled by your load balancers, including client IPs, latencies, request paths, and status codes. These logs are useful for monitoring traffic patterns, investigating anomalies, and ensuring security compliance.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Timestamp when the log entry was generated.

columns.name: NLBType
columns.description: Type of Network Load Balancer (e.g., 'gateway', 'application').

columns.name: Version
columns.description: Version of the NLB log format.

columns.name: Nlb
columns.description: Identifier or name of the Network Load Balancer.

columns.name: Listener
columns.description: Listener configuration used for the connection (protocol and port).

columns.name: ClientIPPort
columns.description: IP address and port of the client initiating the request.

columns.name: TargetIPPort
columns.description: IP address and port of the target receiving the request.

columns.name: ConnectionTime
columns.description: Duration of the connection in milliseconds.

columns.name: TlsHandshakeTime
columns.description: Time taken to complete the TLS handshake in milliseconds.

columns.name: ReceivedBytes
columns.description: Number of bytes received from the client.

columns.name: SentBytes
columns.description: Number of bytes sent to the client.

columns.name: IncomingTLSAlert
columns.description: Details of any incoming TLS alert message.

columns.name: ChosenCertArn
columns.description: ARN of the TLS certificate selected during the handshake.

columns.name: ChosenCertSerial
columns.description: Serial number of the TLS certificate used in the connection.

columns.name: TLSCipher
columns.description: Cipher suite used for the TLS connection.

columns.name: TLSProtocolVersion
columns.description: Version of the TLS protocol used (e.g., TLS 1.2, TLS 1.3).

columns.name: TLSNamedGroup
columns.description: Elliptic curve or Diffie-Hellman group used in the handshake.

columns.name: DomainName
columns.description: Domain name requested by the client via SNI (Server Name Indication).

columns.name: ALPNFEProtocol
columns.description: Application-layer protocol negotiated on the frontend (e.g., HTTP/1.1, h2).

columns.name: ALPNBEProtocol
columns.description: Application-layer protocol negotiated on the backend.

columns.name: ALPNClientPrefList
columns.description: List of application protocols preferred by the client during ALPN.

columns.name: TLSConnectionCreationTime
columns.description: Time taken to establish the complete TLS connection, including handshake.

tables.name: AWSALBAccessLogs
tables.description: This connector allows you to ingest AWS Elastic Load Balancer (ALB, NLB and GLB) logs into Microsoft Sentinel. These logs contain detailed records for requests handled by your load balancers, including client IPs, latencies, request paths, and status codes. These logs are useful for monitoring traffic patterns, investigating anomalies, and ensuring security compliance.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The time when the load balancer received the request.

columns.name: ALBType
columns.description: The type of request (e.g., http or https).

columns.name: Alb
columns.description: The ARN of the Application Load Balancer.

columns.name: ClientIp
columns.description: The IP address of the client.

columns.name: ClientPort
columns.description: The port number of the client.

columns.name: TargetIp
columns.description: The IP address of the target that processed the request.

columns.name: TargetPort
columns.description: The port number of the target that processed the request.

columns.name: RequestProcessingTime
columns.description: The total time taken by the load balancer to receive the request from the client.

columns.name: TargetProcessingTime
columns.description: The total time taken by the target to process the request.

columns.name: ResponseProcessingTime
columns.description: The total time taken by the load balancer to send the response to the client.

columns.name: ElbStatusCode
columns.description: The status code sent from the load balancer to the client.

columns.name: TargetStatusCode
columns.description: The status code received from the target.

columns.name: ReceivedBytes
columns.description: The size of the request, in bytes, received from the client.

columns.name: SentBytes
columns.description: The size of the response, in bytes, sent to the client.

columns.name: RequestRaw
columns.description: The complete request line from the client.

columns.name: UserAgent
columns.description: The user agent String of the client.

columns.name: SslCipher
columns.description: The SSL cipher used for the SSL connection (if any).

columns.name: SslProtocol
columns.description: The SSL protocol used for the SSL connection (if any).

columns.name: TargetGroupArn
columns.description: The ARN of the target group that handled the request.

columns.name: TraceId
columns.description: The trace identifier for the request, useful for debugging.

columns.name: DomainName
columns.description: The SNI domain provided by the client during the TLS handshake.

columns.name: ChosenCertArn
columns.description: The ARN of the certificate presented to the client.

columns.name: MatchedRulePriority
columns.description: The priority value of the rule that matched the request.

columns.name: RequestCreationTime
columns.description: The timestamp when the load balancer generated the request to the target.

columns.name: ActionsExecuted
columns.description: The actions taken when processing the request (e.g., forward, fixed-response, redirect).

columns.name: RedirectUrl
columns.description: The URL of the redirect target, if a redirect action was taken.

columns.name: LambdaErrorReason
columns.description: The reason code for a failed Lambda function, if applicable.

columns.name: TargetPortList
columns.description: A list of IP:port pairs of the targets that handled the request.

columns.name: TargetStatusCodeList
columns.description: A list of status codes returned by the targets.

columns.name: Classification
columns.description: Classification of the request (e.g., success or error).

columns.name: ClassificationReason
columns.description: The reason why a request was classified in a certain way.

columns.name: ConnTraceId
columns.description: The connection trace ID that uniquely identifies the connection.

queries.description: Returns 10 rejected actions of type IPv4.
Returns high severity findings summarize by activity type.
Returns count of created users per region.
